alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 06 at 1:14PM MST until January 07 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 60 to 70 MPH expected. Areas of blowing and drifting snow possible. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range including Bordeaux along Interstate 25 between Chugwater and Wheatland. * WHEN...11 PM MST this evening until 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. There will be a high risk for vehicle blow overs. Areas of blowing and drifting snow could result in periods of very low visibilities as low as one quarter of a mile at times.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County
